conclusion: Object A falls freely from above and the task is to determine where it will collide and land based on gravity, collision, and deflection effects.
The image shows a cone-shaped object labelled A, a round blue ball, four brown cubes arranged in a square ring, and a cloth beneath them.
The cone-shaped object labelled A will hit the round blue ball first.
The collision with the blue ball slightly deflects A toward the centre of the small square blocks.
The impact with the ball robs A of most of its forward speed.
Gravity then makes A topple straight down into the open space between the four brown cubes.
A finally lands on the cloth roughly in the middle of the square block ring.
